description_text:
Job Description

At Piper Sandler, we connect capital with opportunity to build a better future.

We believe that diverse teams with unique backgrounds, skills and experiences yield more innovative solutions. This is reflected in our commitment to engage, hire, and retain bright, committed people to work in partnership within an inclusive environment that allows each person to achieve personal success and add value to our teams and communities.

We are currently looking for an Investment Banking Associate on our Healthcare Services team in New York, NY, Chicago, IL, San Francisco, CA, Charlotte, NC.

Learn more about the team here.

Attracting Only The Very Best Professionals Has Been And Will Continue To Be a Key Element Of Our Success. We Are Focused On Hiring Candidates With Genuine Potential And Interest For Advancement Within Our Firm. A Successful Candidate Will Possess The Following Characteristics

Minimum 3+ years of investment banking experience
Experience with M&A transactions
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including ability to develop internal and external relationships
Strong knowledge of accounting and financial modeling
Highly motivated, team player with strong attention to detail and an ability to learn in a fast-paced environment

As a leading investment bank, we enable growth and success for our clients through deep sector expertise, candid advice and a differentiated, highly productive culture.

Our investment banking clients have access to unparalleled guidance through our deep product and sector expertise and ready access to global capital. We take pride in providing our clients with thoughtful advice and diligent execution, no matter the economic environment. Our investment banking group partners with corporate clients and financial sponsors to provide advisory and financing services related to mergers and acquisitions, equity and debt capital markets, private placements, restructuring and corporate & venture services. We offer in-depth knowledge and industry relationships in our core sectors of chemicals, consumer, diversified industrials & services, energy & power, financial services, healthcare and technology. description_text:
The successful candidate will focus on Business Development and Commercial activities, with an emphasis on partner engagement and market research. They will support the growth of the company’s geothermal base business and other renewable energy projects as they transition from exploration into the development phase.

The Role:
Lead and monitor partner engagement activities, facilitate meetings, and prepare materials for external sharing such as Information Memoranda and other relevant documentation.
Plan, coordinate, and execute site visits to key locations to support the viability assessment of new and existing technologies for power plants, acid mitigation, descaling solutions, and others.
Support the development and evaluation of partnership structures for geothermal and other renewable energy projects.
Conduct evaluations of new project ventures and provide strategic support for internal ad hoc projects.
Perform comprehensive market scans using established sources, including accessing and downloading price and WESM market data through platforms such as NEO. Provide actionable market or industry insights.
Contribute to the development of the company’s long-term strategic plans, short- to medium-term business plans, and annual goals and objectives.
Understand and analyze key insights from Decision Analysis (DA) modeling and evaluation, and conduct modeling for projects or analyses of moderate complexity.

The Individual: 
A graduate in Engineering, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in business development, commercial strategy, or market analysis, ideally within the energy sector. 
Experience in investment banking or financial advisory is highly preferred.
Strong analytical skills, especially in market research, financial modeling, and decision analysis.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, and energy market platforms like NEO or WESM.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data to both internal and external stakeholders.
Demonstrated experience in project management, including managing cross-functional teams and delivering projects on time.
Willing to be based in Makati City.

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

All information supplied will be treated as strictly confidential for the purpose of selection and recruitment.

We serve a range of clients, from public corporations to privately held companies in numerous industries. Our clients and their advisors rely on our premier expertise, deep industry knowledge, and unparalleled responsiveness on complex matters. Learn about our Relentless Excellence® at stout.com.


Stout is a trade name for Stout Risius Ross, LLC, Stout Advisors SA, Stout GmbH, Stout Bluepeak Asia Ltd., and Stout Risius Ross Advisors, LLC, a FINRA-registered broker-dealer and SIPC member firm. The terms "Stout"​ or the "firm"​ refers to one or more of these independent advisory practices.
description_text:
At Stout, we’re dedicated to exceeding expectations in all we do – we call it Relentless Excellence ®. Both our client service and culture are second to none, stemming from our firmwide embrace of our core values: Positive and Team-Oriented, Accountable, Committed, Relationship-Focused, Super-Responsive, and being Great communicators. Sound like a place you can grow and succeed? Read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity to join our team.

Impact You’ll Make:

The Stout ESOP Investment Banking Team is looking for an Associate to handle the day-to-day execution of ESOP Formation, Recapitalization, and Capital Markets transactions. Associates will work under the guidance of product bankers for various transaction and pitch assignments. Successful candidates will be highly technical, detail-oriented, and proficient in content creation and complex financial modeling.

Under the mentorship of seasoned Stout professionals, Associates at Stout will have the opportunity to develop a well-rounded investment banking skill set while gaining significant client exposure.

The ESOP Investment Banking team partners with successful family- and founder-owned businesses to evaluate the advantages of ESOP transactions alongside traditional sell-side options. As the sole financial advisor, we facilitate successful ESOP transactions, typically supported by capital raises led by Stout.

We collaborate with industry bankers and our capital markets team to identify ideal candidates for ESOP exits, often working with owners pursuing a dual-track approach of both ESOP and traditional transactions. Additionally, we assist large, successful companies with established ESOPs in recapitalizations with private capital providers, and support industry bankers in sell-side roles for ESOP-owned companies seeking exits to strategic buyers or private equity.

What You’ll Do:

Create dynamic three-statement financial models, valuation models, and pro forma financial statements incorporating detailed transaction adjustments
Prepare and deliver pitch materials for ESOP formations and recapitalizations, working in partnership with practice leaders throughout the firm and sector leaders within the investment bank to win and execute new mandates
Attend client meetings and present complex deal aspects directly to company shareholders and Board members
Perform extensive financial modeling, structuring, and negotiating of live ESOP transactions Launch transaction plan and manage day-to-day transaction execution activities, including up-to-date transaction timeline, information requests, data room oversight, financial model upkeep, CIM and Databook preparation, Board and Shareholder presentations, lender lists, funds flow, etc.
Conduct due diligence sessions with clients
Conduct quantitative, economic, and industry research
Communicate with key stakeholders not limited to owners, shareholders, financial institutions, and market competitors
Become SME of ESOP transaction ecosystem and feasibility
Play key leadership role in all aspects of the transaction process

What You Bring:

At least 2 years of experience in an investment banking environment with advanced technical skills
ESOP experience and familiarity preferred but not required
Ability to conduct valuation analyses, including Discounted Cash Flow, Leveraged Buyout, Comparable Companies, Precedent Transactions, and Sum-of-the-Parts required
Ability to build diverse financial models from scratch required
Experience working the end-to-end deal execution lifecycle
Prior debt structuring and underwriting experience preferred but not required
Bachelor’s degree required (Finance, Math, or Economics preferred but not required)
Advanced proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Strong communication skills, desire to learn, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment

How You’ll Thrive:

Cultivate a positive, team-oriented approach that fosters collaboration and shared success.
Demonstrate accountability and reliability by consistently delivering high-quality results and meeting expectations.
Exhibit an entrepreneurial mindset and a commitment to excellence in all aspects of your work.
Build meaningful relationships and leverage strong interpersonal skills to create trust and drive outcomes.
Communicate effectively and respond promptly, ensuring clarity and alignment with stakeholders.
Bring intellectual curiosity and a keen attention to detail to problem-solving and decision-making.
Apply advanced analytical and quantitative skills to uncover insights and drive data-informed strategies.
Leverage a deep understanding of the sell-side execution process to navigate complex transactions and achieve optimal results.

Why Stout?

At Stout, we offer a comprehensive Total Rewards program with competitive compensation, benefits, and wellness options tailored to support employees at every stage of life.

We foster a culture of inclusion and respect, embracing diverse perspectives and experiences to drive innovation and success. Our leadership is committed to inclusion and belonging across the organization and in the communities we serve.

We invest in professional growth through ongoing training, mentorship, employee resource groups, and clear performance feedback, ensuring our employees are supported in achieving their career goals.

Stout provides flexible work schedules and a discretionary time off policy to promote work-life balance and help employees lead fulfilling lives.

Learn more about our benefits and commitment to your success.

https://www.stout.com/en/careers/benefits

The specific statements shown in each section of this description are not intended to be all-inclusive. They represent typical elements and criteria necessary to successfully perform the job.

Stout is an Equal Employment Opportunity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of valid job requirements, qualifications and merit without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state or federal law. 

Stout is required by applicable state and local laws to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The range for this role considers several factors including but not limited to prior work and industry experience, education level, and unique skills. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for any applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case.

A reasonable estimate of the current range is $145,000 - $175,000 Annual. This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan. Information about benefits can be found here - https://www.stout.com/en/careers/benefits.

description_text:
About PKF Investment Banking:

PKF Investment Banking is seeking an Investment Banking Summer Analyst for Summer 2026 to join our rapidly growing M&A advisory practice. PKF Investment Banking (www.pkfib.com) is the investment banking affiliate of PKF O’Connor Davies, LLP; focused on providing the highest level of M&A advisory services to private and publicly owned companies across a broad range of industries. PKF Investment Banking is committed to building a leading investment banking firm serving the middle market with strong values and an outstanding work environment.

PKF O’Connor Davies is a top-tier accounting, tax and advisory practice with a long history of serving domestic and international clients. “Know Greater Value” speaks to the confidence and guidance that our clients realize when they work with us. It reinforces our commitment to delivering the highest levels of value, expertise and service in everything we do. Our clients Know Greater Connections, Know Greater Insights and Know Greater Value. “PKF O’Connor Davies” is the brand name under which PKF O’Connor Davies LLP and PKF O’Connor Davies Advisory LLC, independently owned entities, provide professional services in an alternative practice structure in accordance with applicable professional standards. PKF O’Connor Davies LLP is a licensed CPA firm that provides attest services and PKF O’Connor Davies Advisory LLC and its subsidiary entities provide tax and advisory services. For more information, please visit pkfod.com.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Successful candidates should have strong cognitive and interpersonal abilities, want to develop their professional and personal skills, and be motivated by the prospect of joining an entrepreneur-minded firm supported by a leading accounting and advisory platform.

As part of the PKF Investment Banking team you’ll be working hands-on with family- and founder-owned businesses in the lower middle-market and be given exposure to a wide range of industries. Over the course of the summer, you will work closely with the team in preparing analyses and valuation materials, participating in due diligence, supporting the execution of M&A transactions, in addition to ad hoc data and research requests related to our M&A processes and market tracking.

Key Responsibilities:

Prepare business, financial, and operational analyses to assist deal teams on transactions and internal deal processes
Analyze industry and company-specific information, including conducting detailed research and financial statement analysis
Collaborate with senior professionals and deal teams on all aspects of investment banking transactions
Develop marketing materials and client presentations while engaging with senior bankers, clients, lawyers. accountants and other industry professionals

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, as well as the ability to develop meaningful relationships
Ability to manage multiple competing priorities and thrive in a fast-paced and challenging environment
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving abilities
Strong attention to detail and organization
Ability to work independently and as part of a broader team

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or a related field, with expected graduation in December 2026 or Spring 2027
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook
Working knowledge of financial statements and accounting information
Prior relevant internship experience considered a plus but not required

Location:

New York City, NY

Compensation:

The compensation for this position ranges from $25.00 - $30.00 per hour. Actual compensation will be dependent upon the specific role, office location as well as the individual’s qualifications, experience, skills, and certifications.

Additional Information:

PKFOD is an equal opportunity employer. The Firm is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all persons in connection with hiring, assignment, promotion, compensation or other conditions of the employment relationship regardless of race, color, age, sex, marital status, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, philosophy/religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, political affiliation or belief, or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

To all staffing agencies: PKF O'Connor Davies, LLP (“PKFOD”) will not be utilizing agencies to staff this position. Please do not forward resumes to PKFOD partners and/or employees at any of our locations regarding this position. Any recruiter who would like to partner with PKFOD on other positions must have an updated contractual agreement with PKFOD through the Director of Talent Acquisition. Please be reminded, PKFOD is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. All unsolicited resumes will become the property of PKFOD.

We are only considering individuals who are authorized to work in the United States. We will not sponsor work visas.

description_text:
Job#: 3015215

Job Description:

Business Systems Analyst – Investment Banking

Client: Big 5 Bank

Location: Downtown Toronto. Hybrid: Mon/Tues in office.

Duration of Contract/Perm: 12 months contract with potential for extension or conversion.

Hours/week: 37.5 hrs/wk. 9-5 PM, M-F

Start date: January, 2026

Job Overview:

We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Business Systems Analyst (BSA) with a strong background in investment banking or financial services. This role involves working closely with vendors, QA teams, and internal stakeholders to ensure system changes are well-documented, testable, and aligned with business needs. A strong work ethic, excellent documentation skills, and the ability to interpret complex data sets are essential.

Key Responsibilities:

Gather and document detailed business and functional requirements for investment banking systems and applications. 
Analyze vendor documentation (e.g., user guides, release notes) to assess the impact of upgrades and new features on internal systems. 
Collaborate with QA teams to ensure test cases align with documented requirements and business expectations. 
Conduct data profiling and write SQL queries to validate and interpret large datasets (millions of records). 
Identify data gaps, logic mismatches, and edge cases; propose solutions or workarounds. 
Participate in meetings with vendors and internal teams to clarify requirements and system behavior. 
Maintain strong documentation practices, including meeting minutes, change logs, and requirement traceability. 
Support system integration efforts and ensure alignment with front-to-back office processes in investment banking. 

Must-Have Skills:

Strong experience in requirement gathering, documentation, and stakeholder communication 
Familiarity with capital markets, trading systems, or investment operations. 
Ability to write SQL queries, perform data profiling, and interpret data logic. 
Precision in capturing changes and documenting them clearly for QA and development teams. 
Able to work independently with minimal supervision. 
Articulate, diligent, and capable of translating technical details into business language. 
Fast-paced, responsive, and committed to high-quality delivery. 

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with front-to-back office systems in investment banking 
Familiarity with regulatory reporting and compliance in financial services. 
Knowledge of Agile and Waterfall methodologies

description_text:
About the Opportunity
Our client, a leading global investment bank with a proven track record in sponsor coverage and complex deal execution, is seeking an accomplished Vice President to join their growing Financial Sponsors team. This is an exceptional opportunity for a seasoned professional to take on a strategic role advising private equity firms and institutional investors on high-profile transactions, including leveraged buyouts, recapitalizations, and portfolio company financings.
Key Responsibilities
Lead and manage the execution of M&A, leveraged buyouts, recapitalizations, and other strategic transactions for financial sponsor clients.
Oversee deal teams, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and quality of deliverables.
Build and maintain strong relationships with private equity firms and institutional investors.
Drive financial modeling, valuation analysis, and client presentations.
Partner with senior leadership to identify new business opportunities and contribute to revenue growth.

Ideal Candidate Profile
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, or related field; MBA or CFA preferred.
Minimum 7 years of investment banking experience, with a focus on financial sponsors or leveraged finance.
Demonstrated success in leading complex transactions and managing client relationships.
Strong analytical, communication, and leadership skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
If you or someone you know is interested in this role, please don't hesitate to reach out as this role is moving quickly!

description_text:
WE ARE

SoftServe is a global digital solutions company headquartered in Austin, Texas, founded in 1993. Our associates work on 2,000+ projects with clients across North America, EMEA, and LATAM. We are about people who create bold things, make a difference, have fun, and love their work.

The Digital Products, Business Analysis & Consulting CoE helps organizations leverage digital technologies and modern approaches to reduce costs, enhance efficiency, and improve quality across internal operations. By aligning technology with business goals, we support clients in maximizing value, increasing agility, and transforming business models for long-term success in a competitive landscape.

IF YOU ARE

Experienced as a Product Owner, Business Analyst, or Product Manager with 4+ years of relevant experience
Proficient in Corporate and/or Investment Banking products, processes, and systems
Skilled in gathering, structuring, and analyzing business and functional requirements
Confident working directly with business stakeholders, end-users, architects, and vendor teams
Experienced in platform comparison and capability assessment
Proactive, structured, and able to bring clarity in a dynamic, fast-changing environment
Communicating fluently in English within international, cross-functional teams
Flexible to operate in a Sunday–Thursday workweek during the first 3–4 months of the project (full alignment preferred but not mandatory)


AND YOU WANT TO

Contribute to the platform selection process for a major financial institution in the Middle East
Analyze and map complex functional requirements across multiple potential solutions
Prepare documentation such as Business Requirements Documents (BRD), Functional Specifications (FSD), gap analyses, and capability comparison matrices
Facilitate and support discovery sessions, requirements workshops, and vendor solution demonstrations
Collaborate closely with stakeholders to define end-to-end processes in Corporate and Investment Banking
Provide advisory support based on industry best practices
Assist in evaluating digitalization opportunities across onboarding, lending, corporate channels, and loan lifecycle management
Travel onsite to Qatar approximately 20–30% of the time, if required
Engage in a short-term assignment with the possibility of extending the cooperation


TOGETHER WE WILL

Maximize customer and business value through your financial services expertise
Learn from experienced professionals and share best practices across diverse organizations
Leverage access to expert communities, paid certifications, and professional events to support your career growth
Collaborate within a diverse, enterprise-scale environment that encourages innovation
Create meaningful customer impact and contribute to global success, recognized through the Customer Hero Program
Develop your leadership capabilities through dedicated growth and development initiatives
Become part of a professional community where growth, collaboration, and success are shared priorities


SoftServe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, veteran status, and other protected characteristics under applicable law. Let’s put your talents and experience in motion with SoftServe.

description_text:
Location: Canary Wharf, London
Start Date: January 2026
Programme Length: 2-Year Fast-Track Graduate Programme

Salary & Compensation

Base Salary: £42,000 – £47,000 per annum

Annual Performance Bonus: £5,000 – £12,000

Total First-Year Compensation: Up to £59,000

About the Programme

Our Graduate / Trainee Investment Banking Analyst 2026 programme is designed for high-potential graduates looking to launch a front-office investment banking career. Based in our fast-paced Canary Wharf office, this two-year fast-track programme focuses on building strong technical foundations, commercial awareness, and deal execution skills.

You will work closely with experienced bankers on live transactions, gaining exposure to mergers and acquisitions, capital raising, and strategic advisory work. From day one, you will be treated as a core member of the team, with real responsibility and a clear pathway for progression.

What You’ll Do

Support senior bankers on live M&A, fundraising, and advisory mandates.

Build and maintain financial models, valuations, and forecasts.

Prepare pitch books, client presentations, and investment memoranda.

Conduct company, sector, and market research.

Assist with due diligence and transaction execution processes.

Training & Development

Structured technical training covering financial modelling, valuation, and deal execution.

Ongoing coaching from senior bankers and dedicated mentors.

Exposure across key investment banking functions within the two-year programme.

Sponsorship for relevant professional qualifications where appropriate.

Fast-track progression opportunities for top-performing graduates.

Benefits & Perks

Private medical cover, including wellbeing and mental health support.

27 days’ annual leave plus bank holidays.

Pension scheme with employer contributions.

Canary Wharf lifestyle perks, including gym and retail discounts.

Flexible working arrangements where business needs allow.

Graduate networking events, social activities, and professional development workshops.

Who We’re Looking For

Graduates achieving a minimum 2:1 degree (or equivalent).

Strong analytical, numerical, and problem-solving skills.

A genuine interest in investment banking and financial markets.

Excellent communication skills and attention to detail.

Motivation, resilience, and a strong work ethic.

Why Join Us?

This programme offers a rare opportunity to begin your investment banking career in one of the world’s most prestigious financial districts. You’ll gain exposure to complex deals, work alongside experienced professionals, and develop the skills needed to progress quickly within the industry.

Applications are now open for the January 2026 intake

description_text:
Position Overview
My client is seeking a highly driven and experienced Investment Banking Associate to join their dynamic team. This role is ideal for a professional ready to take on greater responsibility in managing deal processes, leading analytical workstreams, and contributing directly to client advisory engagements within a fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities

Lead and oversee complex financial modeling, valuation analyses, and transaction materials to support mergers and acquisitions (M&A), capital raising, and other strategic initiatives.
Manage the preparation and review of pitch books, presentations, and marketing materials for client meetings and investor outreach.
Conduct and supervise industry and company research to assess market dynamics, competitive landscapes, and strategic opportunities.
Drive and coordinate due diligence efforts, including reviewing financial statements, operational data, and third-party analyses.
Work closely with senior bankers and clients to execute transactions, ensuring high-quality deliverables and seamless process management.
Monitor market developments and provide strategic insights to internal teams and clients.
Mentor and guide analysts, ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and professional growth.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or a related field; advanced degrees (MBA, MSF) are a plus.
Minimum of 3-5 years of investment banking experience, including meaningful Associate-level responsibilities.
Proven track record with multiple closed M&A or capital-raising transactions.
Experience within TMT (Technology, Media & Telecom), Consumer, or Business Services sectors preferred.
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills with mastery of Excel, financial modeling, and valuation techniques.
Strong written and verbal communication abilities, with demonstrated experience in drafting client-ready materials.
Ability to manage multiple workstreams, lead junior team members, and perform under tight deadlines in a high-pressure environment.

What My Client Offers

Direct exposure to high-impact transactions and senior decision-makers.
A collaborative, entrepreneurial environment with significant opportunity for advancement.
Competitive compensation, performance incentives, and comprehensive benefits.

Atlantic Group is hiring an Investment Banking Analyst in Montgomery County, PA, for our client. This in-office role supports M&A and capital-raising transactions through valuation analysis, financial modeling, and preparation of CIMs and pitch decks. You will assist with due diligence, perform in-depth industry research, and collaborate with senior bankers to execute deals. Client Reporting: Prepare detailed reports and presentation materials for client assignments, new business development, and strategic engagements.
Due Diligence Support: Assist in due diligence processes by analyzing client and target financials and coordinating with internal and external stakeholders.
Transaction Coordination: Collaborate with deal team members across departments to manage workflow and ensure timely execution of M&A activities.

Qualifications for the Investment Banking Analyst:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field required.
Experience: 1-2 years in investment banking, corporate finance, transaction advisory, or public accounting with a focus on valuation or due diligence.
Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word, including financial modeling and data analysis.
Industry Knowledge: Strong understanding of corporate finance, financial statements, and transaction processes across M&A or capital markets.
Skills & Attributes: Exceptional quantitative aptitude, strong communication abilities, attention to detail, and a collaborative mindset.
Location Preference: Must have strong professional ties to the Greater Philadelphia area.

Application Notice: Qualified candidates will be contacted within 2 business days of application. If an applicant does not meet the above criteria, Atlantic Group will keep your resume on file for future opportunities and may contact you for further discussion.

description_text:
About The Company

The Palmstone Group is a private international holding and investment group with operations across the United States, Europe, the Middle East, and Asia.

At the Palmstone Group, we are more than just a holding company – we are pioneers, visionaries, and catalysts for change. Our mission is simple yet audacious: to build daring ventures that change the world. We operate at the forefront of innovation, across a diverse range of industries, and we are driven by a relentless passion for progress.

We believe that the world is constantly evolving, and so are the needs of its inhabitants. To meet these ever-changing demands, we dare to dream bigger, think bolder, and act faster. Our vision is to be at the vanguard of transformation, leading the way towards a brighter and more sustainable future for all.

Overview

Palmstone Capital is a modern investment-banking and capital-advisory firm, advising mid-market companies across Europe and the U.S. on capital raising, growth financing, and M&A transactions.

We combine institutional-quality execution with a tech-driven origination engine that produces a constant flow of warm, pre-qualified founders already seeking funding or exits.

As a Partner, your focus is simple: close mandates and run deals from start to finish.

You’ll engage directly with interested founders and executives, guiding them through Palmstone’s proprietary short-cycle engagement process – built in-house to close mandates faster and more effectively than the traditional model.

This is a role for experienced dealmakers who want to operate with speed, precision, and autonomy, backed by an infrastructure that handles everything else.

What You’ll Do

Engage directly with interested leads – founders and executives already expressing interest in advisory support.
Lead short, decisive advisory conversations (2 call close process). You’ll diagnose, position, and convert.
Negotiate and close engagement mandates – you own the commercial relationship.
Oversee execution through our internal analysts and investor network until successful closing.
Manage investor communication, data room preparation, and transaction coordination.
Collaborate with Palmstone’s origination team to refine outreach and maximize conversion rates.

What You’ll Get

A constant flow of warm leads – you focus solely on conversion and relationships.
Analyst and execution support for diligence, materials, and investor outreach.
Institutional-grade infrastructure: CRM, automation, compliance, investor coverage, and process templates.
Proven frameworks for mandate origination, investor outreach, and deal management.
The credibility and infrastructure of an established global financial group.
Access to an international network of investors, lenders, and strategic partners.
Freedom to build your own team and structure within an institutional platform.

Compensation

Percentage of engagement and success fees from all mandates you close and manage.
Transparent, performance-based model – no cap, no politics, no hierarchy.
Optional equity or profit participation based on performance.
No fixed salary – this is a partner-level position designed for high-performing closers who want freedom and unlimited upside.

Who You Are

7–10+ years of experience in investment banking, M&A advisory, private equity, or corporate finance.
Proven record of closing mandates – confident leading commercial discussions and moving deals fast.
Deep understanding of capital markets, valuations, and investor communications.
Comfortable in short-cycle sales environments – thrives on direct decision-making and results.
Strong presence and credibility with founders, boards, and investors.
Entrepreneurial and outcome-driven – motivated by ownership, not employment.
Loyal, long-term builder – you want to grow with Palmstone Capital, not just transact through it.

Bad Twin Capital is a lean, transaction-focused advisory firm working on capital raises and M&A transactions ranging from $5M to $500M+ across a wide range of sectors. We work directly with founders, executives, and institutional investors, operating as a small, high-accountability team where performance and results matter.

We are hiring an Investment Banking Associate with meaningful prior experience to take on real responsibility across live transactions, manage analysts, and work directly with partners to scale execution and investor relationships. Minimum Requirements

• Strong financial modeling and valuation skills

description_text:
Investment Banking Analyst / Associate - Food & Beverage
Location: Chicago, IL
A top-tier middle-market investment bank based in Chicago is seeking experienced Investment Banking professionals with a strong track record in M&A transactions. Experience within the Consumer industry is a plu. This role is ideal for candidates with prior investment banking experience who are looking to deepen their sector expertise and contribute to high-impact deal execution.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead and support all aspects of M&A transaction execution, including financial modeling, valuation, due diligence, and preparation of marketing and client materials.
Conduct in-depth industry and company research with a focus on the food and beverage sector.
Prepare and review confidential information memoranda, management presentations, and other transaction-related documents.
Participate in client meetings, negotiations, and strategic discussions alongside senior bankers.
Mentor and guide junior team members, contributing to a collaborative and high-performance culture.

Qualifications:

2+ years of prior investment banking experience at a recognized firm, with direct involvement in M&A transactions.
Demonstrated exposure to or interest in the Consumer industry.
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or a related discipline with strong academic credentials.
Advanced proficiency in financial modeling, valuation methodologies, and Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Strong analytical, communication, and project management skills.
Ability to manage multiple workstreams in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.

linkedin_org_description:
Through its principal subsidiaries, Canaccord Genuity Group Inc. (the Company) is a leading independent, full-service financial services firm, with operations in two principal segments of the securities industry: wealth management and capital markets. Since its establishment in 1950, the Company has been driven by an unwavering commitment to building lasting client relationships. We achieve this by generating value for our individual, institutional and corporate clients through comprehensive investment solutions, brokerage services and investment banking services. The Company has wealth management offices located in Canada, the UK, Guernsey, Jersey, and the Isle of Man and Australia. The Company's international capital markets division operates in North America, UK & Europe, Asia, and Australia. We are driven by your success.

Canaccord Genuity Group Inc. is publicly traded under the symbol CF on the TSX.
description_text:
Who we are:

Canaccord Genuity (CG) is a leading independent full-service financial services firm, with operations in two principal segments of the securities industry: wealth management and capital markets. CG is driven by an unwavering commitment to building lasting client relationships – we achieve this by generating value for our individual, institutional, and corporate clients through comprehensive investment solutions, brokerage, and investment banking services. We are the leading independent wealth management firm in Canada, and the leading mid-market provider of investment banking advisory, equity research, sales and trading services for corporations and institutions.

We pride ourselves on understanding our clients’ needs and finding innovative, tailored solutions. Our entrepreneurial and friendly team will challenge you to learn and grow every day. We value great work and collaboration and strive to eliminate bureaucratic thinking. We’re looking for talented people who thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to have an impact with innovative ideas and best practices.

Come be a part of our Canadian success story and help deliver superior outcomes for our clients. At CG we recognize that diversity across our business strengthens our client relationships and enables more innovative solutions. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. CG provides an accessible candidate experience. If you need any accommodations throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know.

Our Canadian operation, Canaccord Genuity Corp., is currently seeking an Analyst to join our Investment Banking group in Vancouver. Analysts in this group are generalists, gaining experience across the full spectrum of non-resource industries (including Technology, Media, Telecommunications, Consumer Products, Industrials, Real Estate, Healthcare and Financials, among others) and product groups (M&A, Corporate Finance, and Restructuring).

Responsibilities

Work alongside deal teams consisting of Canaccord Genuity professionals at all levels including the senior principles, on a variety of advisory and financing transactions in a variety of diversified sectors;
Play a key role in all aspects of developing and executing transactions, including:
financial analysis
value analysis
detailed modeling
preparation of presentation materials
research of company and industry dynamics
conducting due diligence
preparation of offering documents
marketing transactions
Skills & Qualifications

Completion of a university degree in a business-related discipline;
Minimum of one (1) year of investment banking or relevant finance experience in a similar role – experience in both M&A and corporate finance preferred;
Solid quantitative skills including strong financial modeling skills;
Strong analytical ability and written communication skills;
Resourceful, diligent and strong attention to detail;
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities. 

Salary range: $95,000

#INDHP

All applications will be held in strict confidence.

In order to be considered for employment, candidates selected for interviews will be required to show proof of citizenship, permanent residence or eligibility to work in Canada with no restrictions.

Protecting your online safety:

Canaccord Genuity and its affiliates do not use text messages for recruitment purposes. If you have received a text message claiming to be from CG or an authorized representative regarding job recruitment, please treat as fraudulent and do not respond.

We wish to thank all candidates for their interest but only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please. Thank you for your understanding.

title: Remote Investment Banking Specialist ($100/hr) - 42463
linkedin_org_slogan: Accelerating frontier AI research & building proprietary intelligence for enterprises. AI powered, human led
linkedin_org_locations: 1900 Embarcadero Rd, Palo Alto, California, US
linkedin_org_description:
Turing is one of the world’s fastest-growing AI companies accelerating the advancement and deployment of powerful AI systems.

Turing helps customers in two ways: Working with the world’s leading AI labs to advance frontier model capabilities in thinking, reasoning, coding, agentic behavior, multimodality, multilinguality, STEM and frontier knowledge; and leveraging that work to build real-world AI systems that solve mission-critical priorities for companies.

Powering this growth is Turing’s talent cloud—an AI-vetted pool of 4M+ software engineers, data scientists, and STEM experts who can train models and build AI applications. All of this is orchestrated by ALAN—our AI-powered platform for matching and managing talent, and generating high-quality human and synthetic data to improve model performance. ALAN also accelerates workflows for model and agent evals, supervised fine-tuning, reinforcement learning, reinforcement learning with human feedback, preference-pair generation, benchmarking, data capture for pre-training, post-training, and building AI applications.

Turing—based in San Francisco, California—was named #1 on The Information’s annual list of “Top 50 Most Promising B2B Companies,” and has been profiled by Fast Company, TechCrunch, Reuters, Semafor, VentureBeat, Entrepreneur, CNBC, Forbes, and many others. Turing’s leadership team includes AI technologists from Meta, Google, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, X, Stanford, Caltech, and MIT.
description_text:
Role Overview:
Turing is seeking Finance Professionals with strong Investment Banking backgrounds to guide how frontier AI systems learn and reason about complex financial transactions. Your expertise in M&A, IPOs, and deal structuring will directly shape the way AI interprets and models high-stakes corporate finance decisions.

This is a remote, highly flexible consulting role that pays $100/hr. Work from anywhere, on your own schedule, while applying your IB experience to influence the next generation of AI-driven capital markets analysis. No AI experience required for this role.

What You’ll Do:
Review AI-generated analyses of LBOs, IPO pricing, and M&A valuations.
Evaluate model performance on live-deal inspired case studies.
Develop scoring rubrics and benchmarks that reflect real transaction dynamics.
Collaborate with a global team of quant researchers, economists, and fellow IB specialists.

What We’re Looking For:
2+ years of Investment Banking experience (M&A, IPOs, restructuring, or capital raising).
Proven track record in deal modelling, valuations, or transaction advisory.
Strong knowledge of corporate finance, risk, and capital structure.
Excellent written communication.
No AI experience required
Preferred: CFA (any level), CA/CPA, or MBA in Finance.

Offer Details:
Engagement: Advisory consulting (~10–30 hrs/week).
Location: Fully remote — work anywhere, anytime.
Duration: Initial 1-month pilot, with potential for multi-month projects.
Compensation: $100/hr+ consulting rate.

About Us:
Based in San Francisco, California, Turing is the world’s leading research accelerator for frontier AI labs and a trusted partner for global enterprises deploying advanced AI systems.

Turing supports customers in two ways: first, by accelerating frontier research with high-quality data, advanced training pipelines, plus top AI researchers who specialize in software engineering, logical reasoning, STEM, multilinguality, multimodality, and agents; and second, by applying that expertise to help enterprises transform AI from proof of concept into proprietary intelligence with systems that perform reliably, deliver measurable impact, and drive lasting results on the P&L.

After applying, you’ll receive a login link by email. Please complete your profile promptly so we can proceed with your application.

We’re actively hiring for this role. If you know exceptional talent, please refer them at turing.com/referrals and earn money for successful referrals.
Show more Show less

description_text:
Role Overview:
Turing is seeking Finance Professionals with strong Investment Banking backgrounds to guide how frontier AI systems learn and reason about complex financial transactions. Your expertise in M&A, IPOs, and deal structuring will directly shape the way AI interprets and models high-stakes corporate finance decisions.

This is a remote, highly flexible consulting role that pays $100/hr. Work from anywhere, on your own schedule, while applying your IB experience to influence the next generation of AI-driven capital markets analysis. No AI experience required for this role.

What You’ll Do:
Review AI-generated analyses of LBOs, IPO pricing, and M&A valuations.
Evaluate model performance on live-deal inspired case studies.
Develop scoring rubrics and benchmarks that reflect real transaction dynamics.
Collaborate with a global team of quant researchers, economists, and fellow IB specialists.

What We’re Looking For:
2+ years of Investment Banking experience (M&A, IPOs, restructuring, or capital raising).
Proven track record in deal modelling, valuations, or transaction advisory.
Strong knowledge of corporate finance, risk, and capital structure.
Excellent written communication.
No AI experience required
Preferred: CFA (any level), CA/CPA, or MBA in Finance.

Offer Details:
Engagement: Advisory consulting (~10–30 hrs/week).
Location: Fully remote — work anywhere, anytime.
Duration: Initial 1-month pilot, with potential for multi-month projects.

description_text:
About The Job

Mercor connects elite creative and technical talent with leading AI research labs. Headquartered in San Francisco, our investors include Benchmark, General Catalyst, Peter Thiel, Adam D'Angelo, Larry Summers, and Jack Dorsey.

Position: Financial Analysis Expert

Type: Contract

Compensation: $90–$100/hour

Location: Remote

Duration: 2 months

Commitment: 10–15 hours/week

Role Responsibilities

Interpret and analyze company financial statements and disclosures.
Cross-reference narrative sections with quantitative data for comprehensive insights.
Calculate key financial metrics such as YoY revenue growth to assess performance.
Identify and explain primary drivers of financial performance.
Deliver concise written analyses aligned with AI training goals.
Work independently and asynchronously to meet project deadlines.

Qualifications

Must-Have

2+ years of experience in investment banking, private equity, equity research, or consulting.
Strong proficiency in financial modeling and accounting principles.
Expertise in interpreting 10-K/10-Q filings and MD&A sections.
Excellent analytical and written communication skills.
Comfort working independently with minimal guidance.

Compensation & Legal

Independent contractor
Payments processed weekly via Stripe Connect

Application Process (Takes 20–30 mins to complete)

Submit your resume to get started.
You may be asked to complete a brief skills assessment.
We typically follow up within 3–5 business days.

Resources & Support

For details about the interview process and platform information, please check: https://talent.docs.mercor.com/welcome/welcome
For any help or support, reach out to: support@mercor.com

PS: Our team reviews applications daily. Please complete your AI interview and application steps to be considered for this opportunity.

description_text:
Position Description

The Head of Corporate Finance and Capital Markets is responsible for preparing materials for origination efforts as well as executing live transactions. These transactions would include deals in the ECM or M&A space such as IPOs, private placements, rights issues, private capital fundraising, take-privates, etc.

Key activities include presenting findings of research and analysis, due diligence, financial modelling, valuation, assisting with administrative duties (e.g. roadshows, printing reports etc.), as well as preparing documentation relating to various internal and external processes

Key Areas Of Responsibilities

Comprise 50% Malaysia Investment Banking coverage and 50% ECM / M&A.
Malaysian Investment Banking coverage role based in Kuala Lumpur for primarily Malaysian and Southeast Asia transactions, reporting to Head of IB.
ECM role for Southeast Asia transactions reporting to ECM Director.
Maintain credentials and databases.
Support the senior bankers and broader team as required.
Train and mentor analysts and interns.


Requirements

Bachelor’s degree or above in Business/Finance-related discipline
Minimum 6-8 years of relevant CF experience including financial modelling, valuation, preparation of pitch books, review of legal documents and due diligence.
Prior Investment Banking experience, preferably having completed deals in SE Asia, is a plus
Ensure data integrity and fact checks on all work undertaken.
Strong analytical skills coupled with the ability to devise creative solutions to problems.
Fluent in both spoken and written Business Mandarin
A diligent, responsible person who is eager to learn
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
High degree of integrity 
Self-motivated and able to operate independently, drawing from previous transaction experience to hit the ground running
Ability to take the initiative

description_text:
Investment Services Expert
Hourly Contract | Part-time Remote 
$80 –$150 per hour
About the Role
A leading AI research initiative is recruiting Investment Services Experts to collaborate on a frontier project that enhances large language models (LLMs) for real-world financial reasoning.
In this role, you’ll leverage your expertise across investment banking, private equity, asset management, or equity research to evaluate, design, and refine AI workflows that simulate complex financial analysis and decision-making.
Your work will help shape how next-generation AI systems interpret markets, evaluate deals, and forecast business outcomes with human-level accuracy.
Key Responsibilities
Evaluate AI-generated investment analyses for accuracy, clarity, and strategic rigor.
Calibrate AI decision-making in areas like valuation modeling, portfolio analysis, financial forecasting, and risk assessment.
Design and validate structured tasks that mirror real-world workflows in investment services.
Provide written and analytical feedback to improve model reasoning, depth, and realism.
Collaborate asynchronously with AI researchers to ensure content quality and business alignment.
Ideal Qualifications
2+ years of experience in investment services — including investment banking, private equity, asset management, or equity research.
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, or Business Administration (Advanced degrees or CFA/CPA/CAIA certifications are a plus).
Deep understanding of valuation, financial modeling, market analysis, and portfolio management.
Strong quantitative and analytical reasoning skills.
Exceptional communication and attention to detail — ability to distill complex concepts into actionable insights.
Project Timeline
Start Date: Immediate
Duration: 1–2 months
Commitment: ~20 hours/week (flexible, part-time)
Schedule: Fully remote and asynchronous — work at your own pace
Compensation & Contract
Rate: $80–$120 USD/hour (based on experience)
Bonuses: Top performers earn weekly incentives of $20–$100/hr on top of base pay
Contract Type: Independent contractor
Payments: Daily via Stripe Connect
Application & Onboarding Process
Upload your resume or CV.
Complete a short AI interview (no prep required).
Participate in a paid, 3-hour work trial to assess your ability to interpret project guidelines and produce high-quality investment-related content.
⚡ PS: Mercor team reviews applications daily. Please complete your AI interview and application steps to be considered for this opportunity. ⚡

linkedin_org_description:
Allert & Co. - as an M&A-Consultancy - is specialized in value-oriented transactions in small and mid-cap companies. 

Constantly changing background conditions such as the internationalization of markets, increasing pressure on growth, changing rules and customs in the financing and managing of companies and importantly also the forthcoming transition between generations in the top management positions in most companies are inevitably defining the new challenges within the small and mid-cap industry: However new fiscal oriented methods become necessary. 

With Allert & Co. companies are able to bear this challenge secure and efficient: By collaborating with Allert & Co.
corporate trade sale and corporate acquisition on international and national markets become a strategic instrument for the future-oriented management, even in critical phases. 

The required of financial, tax and management knowhow are essential elements of Allert & Co.’s activity.
description_text:
Du hast bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung und suchst nach einer neuen Herausforderung? Du willst Dich weiterentwickeln und die Vorteile eines mittelständischen M&A-Beratungsunternehmens kennenlernen? Egal wo Du Dich gerade in Deiner beruflichen Karriere befindest, wir bieten Dir die passende Lösung und arbeiten gemeinsam mit Dir an Deiner Weiterentwicklung. Auch wenn up-or-out eine für Beratungsgesellschaften typische Sichtweise auf Karrierewege ist, schauen wir über diesen begrenzten Tellerrand hinaus und suchen individuelle Rahmenbedingungen.

Aufgaben

Eigenverantwortliche Akquisition von nationalen und internationalen M&A-Mandaten sowie Repräsentation von

Allert & Co. nach außen

Weitgehend selbstständige Steuerung ausgewählter Mandate sowie Führung des Transaktionsteams

Ständige Interaktion mit unseren Mandanten und Transaktionspartnern zur Gewährleistung eines reibungslosen Projektverlaufs

Selbstständige Organisation und Durchführung von unterschiedlichen Due-Diligence-Prozessen

Beteiligung an Verhandlungen und Marketingaktivitäten

Ausbildung, Führung und Steuerung von Associates und Analysten

Unterstützung beim Aufbau und der kontinuierlichen Pflege von Kundenbeziehungen

Verantwortliche Übernahme unternehmensbezogener Projekte


Qualifikation

Überdurchschnittlicher Abschluss eines wirtschaftswissen-schaftlichen/wirtschaftsnahen Studiums mit den Schwerpunkten Corporate Finance, Rechnungslegung und/oder Finanzierung

Fundierte Berufserfahrung im Bereich Corporate Finance/M&A bei einer M&A-Boutique, Investmentbank, Corporate-Finance-Beratung oder Wirtschaftsprüfungsgesellschaft

Nachweisbare Erfolge und mehrjährige Erfahrung bei der eigenverantwortlichen Akquise und der Abwicklung von M&A-Verkaufsmandaten

Positive verkäuferische Einstellung

Tiefe Kenntnis in den Bereichen Financial Modelling, Finanzanalyse, Rechnungslegung sowie Unternehmensplanung

Belastbare und kommunikationsstarke Persönlichkeit mit unternehmerischem Denken und Handeln sowie zuvorkommendem Auftreten

Hohe Einsatzbereitschaft, herausragende analytische Fähigkeiten, hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative, gutes Commercial Judgement und Spaß an anspruchsvoller Teamarbeit

Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie den sicheren Umgang mit allen MS-Office-Anwendungen setzen wir voraus


Benefits

Ein maßgeschneidertes fachliches und persönliches Entwicklungsprogramm auf höchstem Niveau (u.a. Trainings in London/UK und USA)

Ein attraktives Gehaltspaket plus leistungsabhängige Vergütung

Einen für die Branche bereits beispielhaften Dealflow als Basis für die weitere Geschäftsentwicklung

Echtes „State-of-the-Art“-Equipment und nahezu alle international renommierten Datenbanken sowie ein leistungsstarkes, hervorragend ausgebildetes Team von Analysten und Associates als Rüstzeug für maximale Abschlussstärke

Ein zertifiziertes Qualitätsmanagementsystem, das sowohl Kern- als auch Unterstützungsprozesse auf Effektivität, Effizienz und Deinen Erfolg ausrichtet

Du bist als Director entscheidender Treiber unserer nachhaltigen Firmenphilosophie und sicherst im Zuge Deiner Mandate Werte und Arbeitsplätze

Einen Unternehmenssitz in einer boomenden Region mit Charme und Lebensqualität


Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung.

description_text:
Blacklock Group is seeking an Investment Banking Associate to join a high-performing, boutique investment bank. This is a Generalist M&A role, and no specific sector background is required.

Key Responsibilities:
Prepare and maintain marketing materials, pitch books, and valuation analyses
Develop Confidential Information Memoranda (CIMs) and investor presentations
Build and review financial models, including traditional valuation techniques and industry-specific methodologies
Organise, analyse, and manage due diligence materials with a high degree of accuracy and efficiency
Create ad hoc transaction-related documents and process materials
Support client relationships and execute transactions in a fast-paced, time-sensitive environment

Experience, Skills & Requirements:
2–4 years of experience in investment banking, M&A advisory, or a closely related transaction-focused role
Strong execution experience across sell-side and/or buy-side M&A transactions
Advanced financial modelling and valuation skills, including DCF, comparable companies, precedent transactions, and LBO analysis
Ability to independently manage workstreams, review analyst output, and ensure accuracy across all transaction materials
Strong understanding of the full M&A transaction lifecycle, including marketing, due diligence, negotiation, and closing processes
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to interact professionally with clients, buyers, and senior advisors
Highly organised, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple live transactions in a fast-paced environment
Advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint, with experience producing high-quality pitch decks, CIMs, management presentations, and board-level materials
Strong grasp of corporate finance concepts, including financial statement analysis, capital structure, working capital, and transaction structuring
Proven ability to work independently while contributing effectively within small deal teams
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field; MBA, CFA, or CPA is advantageous but not required

Mercor is recruiting Investment Banking and Private Equity Experts based in the U.S., UK, Canada, Europe, Singapore, Dubai, or Australia for a research collaboration with a leading foundational AI lab. This role is ideal for finance professionals with real deal execution experience who are comfortable building financial models from scratch and applying deep capital markets expertise to structured AI training tasks.
This is a fully asynchronous, part-time contract where you can contribute on your own schedule and deliver highly realistic financial work products reflective of real on-desk execution.

Build financial models from scratch, mirroring real-world on-desk work

Work independently while adhering to structured task formats and timelines
3. Ideal Qualifications
2+ years of full-time experience at a top-tier investment bank or private equity firm
Demonstrated hands-on deal execution experience (academic experience does not qualify)
Ability to replicate real modeling work with rigor and precision
Exceptional communication, analytical reasoning, and financial modeling skills
Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently
4. More About the Opportunity
Fully remote and asynchronous — work around your existing schedule
Expected commitment: 20+ hours per week
Contract duration: through end of January, with the possibility of extension
Strong performance increases eligibility for future high-paying projects with Mercor
